body_html:
Yes, _Send and _Recv cannot send / receive refs, because those are not transferrable. But this should not be possible.
…
On Thu, Jun 28, 2018 at 6:04 PM Yan Facai (颜发才) ***@***.***> wrote: @alextp <https://github.com/alextp> I'm afraid not, because those tests failed are related to float16. Moreover, they are all passed in CPU and GPU(Python2) environment. I don't know why we bind _Recv node with a ref type tensor_type=DT_HALF_REF. Is it a bug when building graph? — You are receiving this because you were mentioned. body_text:
Yes, _Send and _Recv cannot send / receive refs, because those are not
transferrable. But this should not be possible.

body:
Yes, _Send and _Recv cannot send / receive refs, because those are not
transferrable. But this should not be possible.

On Thu, Jun 28, 2018 at 6:04 PM Yan Facai (颜发才) <notifications@github.com>
wrote:

> @alextp <https://github.com/alextp> I'm afraid not, because those tests
> failed are related to float16. Moreover, they are all passed in CPU and
> GPU(Python2) environment.
>
> I don't know why we bind _Recv node with a ref type
> tensor_type=DT_HALF_REF. Is it a bug when building graph?
>
> —
> You are receiving this because you were mentioned.
